intro: Rubus chenevardianus, commonly known as the Chenevard blackberry, is a species of bramble native to eastern North America. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
